benchmark_details.name: ReMUD (Reasoning Multimodal Ultrasound Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: ReMUD is established as the first open-source medical reasoning QA supervised fine-tuning dataset specifically tailored for ultrasound, containing over 45,000 reasoning and non-reasoning Question Answering (QA) and Visual Question Answering (VQA) data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate research in the specific domain of medical ultrasound through a large-scale, multimodal dataset for reasoning models.

data.source: Publicly available ultrasound materials, including textbooks, clinical guidelines, and datasets sourced from the internet.
data.annotation: Automatically generated VQA triplets using multimodal language models.

methodology.calculation: pass@1 is calculated as the average proportion of correct responses among generated answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher pass@1 values indicate better model performance in selecting correct answers.
methodology.validation: The validation procedures include quality checks using scoring systems to assess the accuracy of generated data.
